issue.title: [Developer] Add more prominent notice to GitHub issue template to direct bug reports to JIRA
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-5526](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5526). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Many people are deleting the issue template without reading it. I will change the template to feature a more prominent notice about filing bug reports in JIRA

Recent examples

- https://github.com/apache/arrow/issues/4489
- https://github.com/apache/arrow/issues/4495

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5526?focusedCommentId=16858765) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
Alternatively, we could turn off GitHub issues. Just spot checking some of the big Apache projects that come to mind (Spark, Hadoop, etc.), none of them have issues enabled.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5526?focusedCommentId=16858789) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
In our experience prior to enabling GitHub issues, many would-be bug reporters would simply not bother reporting at all. So I'd rather capture the issue if the contributor does not take the time to read the project README

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5526?focusedCommentId=16863370) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Issue resolved by pull request 4536
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4536>
